SENT.plain: We report a case of mosaic trisomy 15 with mental retardation, facial dysmorphism, and hemihypertrophy, but no manifestations of Prader-Willi or Angelman syndromes
Mosaic trisomy 15 (11%) was discovered at the amniocentesis
Uniparental disomy for chromosome 15 was excluded by molecular analysis
Post-natal blood karyotype and examination were normal
Mosaic was confirmed on skin fibroblasts, placenta and cord
Evolution was marked by progressive right hemi-hypertrophy, and developmental delay
Our case is the first patient reported with hemihypertrophy associated with mosaic trisomy 15
